intro: Hieracium transiens subsp. leilae, commonly known as the Leilae hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. It is a relatively rare and specialized species, adapted to the harsh environments of its native range.
